titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. VI. Heard Hawley. 1. Timothy 6.6. A funeral Sermon, for Mrs Middleton. Little P.M. 1. Peter 3.8. Card to Eaton at O’Neal’s— Saw Dickinson. Large Mail—from Rush, Shaler, Hughes, Wilcock, and Taylor— Met Cushman and White. Death of A. K. Parris.— Cards to R. M. & J. T. Johnson— Eve reading.

2. VI:45.Coll. Dwight here— E. Wyer at the Office— Leonard’s die. 17th. Congress 2. Session commenced— At [symbols]— W. Taylor’s Letter— Mexico. Rush and Shaler’s— Algiers— Cabinet Meeting for to-morrow. Evening at Tingey’s— M. L. Hill— Rodgers— Wingates. Anderson, Miller’s— Chess.

3. VII— Snow. Cabinet Meeting— Algiers— Crawford, Calhoun, Thompson— Shaler’s Letter— Jones’s to Secy Navy— Ibrahim to Jones— Consular Journal— Calhoun for waiting— Crawford for disapproving young Shaler immediately— Uselessness of having any Consul at Algiers— Vessel to be sent with Instructions immediately— Mexico— Minister to be admitted immediately— Crawford went away— After Conversation with [symbols]— Uselessness of the Missions— First weekly Evening party— Thin— Canning— Message sent in— Clark Clerk— Members at [symbols]— Parrott, Knight, Chandler, L M’Lean and Archer.

4. VII. Fahrenheit 9— Fuller, Kent, Woodson, J. S. Smith here— At the Office— J. S. Smith with Letter from C. Hughes— Cards. Cambreleng, Newton.— Farrelly, Garnett, Dickinson, W. Patterson, Read, Wright, Tatnall, Gilmer.— P. LittleCanning— Statements from Jamaica. Colonial Intercourse— Act of 3. March 1815. a new pretension— Steam-boat Report— Mrs Adams ill in bed.

5. VII.Moore of Alabama, Saunders, Rogers and Franks, with Letter from Gregg, and Morgan— J. Lloyd— Blackledge, Butler, Hill, Woodcock. S. Edwards, Hemphill— At the Office Eustis— His talk about Hull and Binney— Roberts for a Consulate— M’Kenney’s Letter— Answer to Menou and Ellison— George dined at Canning’s— Kirkland with packet from Van der Kemp—

6. VI.Burton, Conner, Talbot, Breckenridge, J. S. Smith, Conkling, C. Ruggles, Bigelow, Cushman, A. Sterling, White, Mitchell, Archer, Newton, Eaton, Rhea, Watkins & Torrens, Fuller and Steele at Office. Call at Dowson’s— At Burch’s— Saw Vice President Tompkins,Eustis, S. Smith. Visits to Tattnall, Macon, Gilmer. H.R. had adjourned— Letters to C. Nag. . . about Smith a prisoner from an Artigas privateer, and to R. Campbell. General Petry here at Eve. Whist.

7. VII.15— Met E. B. Jackson—about Printers at Wheeling and Clarksburg. Visits to Fuller—Phillips and Patterson there—to P. P. Barbour— Cards to
Govr Barbour and Breckenridge— Met Farrelly— Memorial of R Alden— Cards from Pierson, A. Sterling, T. H. Hubbard, Barber of Connt.Mark Harris, Tomlinson, Rochester, Williamson, Dane, Russ, Jer. Nelson, Reed, Edwards of Connt. Also G. W. Erving, Captain Hook, Lieutt. Dean, and Mr John H. Houston— Letter from F. Jones to answer— At P.U.S.Thompson there— Piracies— Plan for suppressing them— Mexican Minister— Presidential Entertainments.

8. V: Heard Little. Deuteronomy 33.29. Pleasants’s— Whipple— Visit to D. P. Cook— Edwards of Connt.—and Stewart— Call at Hickey’s— Colden & Taylor, not there— Met Petry and Taylor— Baker P.M— Hosea 7–8. Frye here at Eve— Unable to write— W. Lee here— Card from Southard.

9. VII.Williamson here. Eastern boundary— J. T. Jackson and Cannon— Vance and R. J. Meigs. Walworth, M’Carty and Scott— Cards from Gebhard & Upham. Visit to Mrs Lloyd at Woodside’s— To C. A. Rodney at Pleasonton’s but he was gone— Ringgold Marshal at the Office— Horse thief demanded from N. Jersey. Pleasonton and Dupont— Domestic Manufactures— Calhoun. District Judge S.C. Piracies, the Message and Cuba— At P.U.S— Thompson there— Piracies. Cuba, the Navy, G-Britain and Spain— Cabinet Meeting fixed for to-morrow at one— Duponceau papers sent to Crawford— Isaac Fisher’s Letter— Advice of P.U.S—first to ask Tod, about the character of Fisher— Watkins and Walter spent the Eve here. A. Smyth’s Letter.

10. VII.D. Brent here— Cards from Baylies, Archer, Alexander, & James Barbour. At the Office, Watkins and Torrens— Note from M. J. Zozaya. Mexican Minister— Answer, to see him to-morrow— A. Hamilton— Affairs of Florida. To write me. Cabinet Meeting— All present— Crawford late. P.U.S. read his opinion upon diplomatic compensations— Cuba, Piracies, G. Britain, Spain, Duponceau’s papers— Power to land; whether to be given by Act of Congress— Crawford’s and Calhoun’s opinions adverse— Thompsons and mine for it— To instruct Forsyth—and send M’Rae to Cuba— Complication— Meeting sat till near 5— Evening weekly party— Say 100.

11. V:45.Allen of Masstts. and Borland here. Cards from Edwards of Illinois, Thompson of Georgia, R. Allen. W. Smith of Virginia, Dr Jones, Harvey, Hobart, Plumer, and Whipple— Metropolis Bank with Bills. At the Office— Force, Roberdeau and Griffiths— Museum— Zozaya and Torrens— Full-Power, for Credentials— The reason— At P.U.S. Agent at Cuba—immediately— My objections to over-haste— M’Rae— Letter to J. Forsyth— Dined at Petry’s— Laborie here at Eve. Parrett and Mason at the Office— D. P. Cook here this Morning.

12. VI.Noble and Jennings here—and C. Bulfinch— Cards from Ingham, W. Findlay, Govan, Mercer, and Warfield— Presented Jose Manuel Zozaya Mexican Minister to P.U.S— With Torrens, his Secretary of Legation— His after remarks— Wyer to Madrid & Shaler—draft to Forsyth, further measures— New Minister to Spain— Agent to Cuba— Forsyth’s N. 48— Canning & Zozaya— Company to dine— 21 at table— Cambreleng.

13. V: At O’Neal’s. Dupont gone— At the Office. Don Jose, Manuel Zozaya, Don Jose Anastacio Torrens, Padre Juan Ygnacio Villaseñor, and Don Francisco de Paula Tamariz—with list of the Legation— Pedersen, F. Johnson, and R. King— Enquiries about Baron Francois de Maltitz— Secretary to the Russian Legation— Colonial Intercourse— French Convention— Separate Article— Lloyd’s motion. Piracies. Cuba— King’s objections to it— ClayTompkinsCalhoun— Thompson— King’s Slave-State and Western Antipathies— Aversion to the power of small States— Districting— Bad Constitution— Eve— Ball at . . .wn’s. Mexicans there. Chess with G. Tucker.

14. VI. Visit to Noble— Cards to Jennings and Vance.— Tod not at his lodgings. Visit to the Mexican Minister— Torrens, Villaseñor and Tamariz there— At the Office. Burton, requesting me to write to Hammett, about Broadbent. S. Wood— New-York Politics— Captain Alvey with despatches from Forsyth. His claims on Spain—injuries suffered. James Barbour— Chairman Comee. S.U.S. Foreign Affairs— British Colonial intercourse— Asks me to draft a Bill—and send him papers— E. B. Jackson—District Attorney and Marshal Western District of Virginia— Commissions to be renewed— Tracy— New-York Politics— Breaking up of Combinations— At P.U.S.Calhoun there. District Judge S. C.Lee— Drafts of despatches to Forsyth— San Miguel’s Note. P.U.S. doubts about Agent to Cuba. Papers to be sent round— Meeting for Monday at 1.— U.S. Bank Directors— C. J. Ingersoll, Hawkins, W. Patterson, Dupont— P.U.S. sends for P. Little— George dined at Tayloe’s— Breakfasted with Coxe Idle Evening— I met this Morning B. Ruggles S.U.S— Accounts of Wilcocks—Marshal of Connecticut. Cards from R. R. Reid and Sibley— Letter from N. Pope.

15. V:30. Heard M’Ilvaine—Romans 8.6.7. House crowded. Visit at Claxton’s. Bassett, Plumer, Harvey, Whipple, Cocke, F. Jones, Leftwich, Barton, Hobart not there— At Coyle’s—Parrott, Holmes of Mississippi, Mrs Baylies, Mrs Wool— At Tims’sDickerson, Rodney, Gaillard not there— Queen’s Hotel. Card to Rogers— P.M. heard Little. Peter 1.1.8. Visit at Fletcher’s— Miss White— Cushman, Borland, Williamson, M. Sterling, White andEvening Mrs & Miss Forrest, Mrs W. S. Smith & Laborie here. Draft of British Colonial Intercourse Bill.

16. VI.T. R. Rogers here. Consulates for Shoemaker and Franks— Cabinet Meeting— Crawford, Calhoun, Thompson present— Draughts to Forsyth and M’Rae considered—determined to be sent. San Miguel’s objection—its motive. Peacock ready at Norfolk— The dinner— Canning’s etiquette— Crawford thinksZozaya to be first entertained as guest—and then with Diplomatic Corps— My opinion, not to vary from the usage— To leave Canning &c—to act for himself. Crawford and P.U.S. assent to this course— Mitchell’s Accounts—again to be referred to 5th. Auditor— Mis-statements— Cathcart’s claims—also to be referred to 5th. Auditor— I spoke to P.U.S. of the draught for a Colonial intercourse Bill—and James Barbour’s proposals— Letter to M’Rae sent— Long Note from Anduaga— Palmyra’s case— Eve at Walter’s Oration upon Poetry. Cards from J. Nelson and Holmes of Mississippi.

17. VII.Rocofeurte, with Letter from N. Taylor— L. Williams and Dr Caldwell of N.C. Roberdeau and Macomb & Lincoln here— Clay’s Note in the Intelligencer— E. Law, Lieutent. Freeman about Amory at the Office— Pleasonton, about Mitchell’s and Cathcart’s claims— Hamilton—with a claim— Stackelberg with a Note, and the Mexican question— At P.U.S. with draft of Colonial intercourse Bill and papers— Evening weekly party.

18. VII:Bailey and Kingman at the Office. Holmes of Maine and Chandler. The boundary question— E. Wyer—for Spain— Letter to Forsyth— Credential for M’Rae— Evening, draft of answer to Smyth. Note in answer to Clay— Coll. R. M. Johnson here— read to him my note.

19. VII—Fuller here— Harris and Upham petition for A. Brown— Chase’s pardon—read to Fuller the beginning of my draught vs Smyth— At the Office. Rodney, for the papers in the case of the Pitt— Metcalfe— Swift, with a Letter from Constancio— Mariana Flora and Piracy— Farrelly with young Walker— Stackelberg— Invitation to P.U.S. the 24th. Wants & fears to send an excuse— Letter to Mrs Pinkney— At P.U.S. At dinner— We had company to dine— My answer to Clay in the Intelligencer— Letter to Pedersen.

20. VI.Ellisen at the Office— Russian Ratifications— The house and Menou. At P.U.S.Thompson and Calhoun there. Johnson’s decision, upon the Palmyra— My drafts—approved— Eve at Pleasonton’s— Spoke to Canning. Wyer at the Office— Russell and Holmes.

21. VII.Zozaya— Torrens & Tamariz here— Letter from Wilcocks— Southard Letters for Steele. At the Office— Mr Plumer— Metcalfe— Walter’s Oration. George went— Dr Mease, Coll. Dwight, Maltitz, and Laborie here. Chess with Dwight.

22. VII. Heard Breckenridge at the Capitol— 2. Timothy 4.7. Visit to Gorham at Peck’s Georgetown— No Meeting at Little’s P.M— Met Cushman. He came
and sat an hour with me— Maine Politics— King— Holmes—Calhoun— Menou here this Evening— His embarras— Writing—

23. VI:30—Southard here— Stackelberg at the Office— His scruples and fears— At P.U.S. Met Thompson there— Gregory and Judge W. Johnson— Told P.U.S. Of the diplomatic difficulties— Evening at Canning’s. Ball Chess with Dr Tucker and Colden. Stackelberg’s Palinodia— Canning. Brent here this Morning.

24. VII—Southard here— Elkins for legislative Council Florida— Young Maury— Notes about the dinner at P.U.S— At the Office— Govr. Cass and Doty— Wyer— Menou, to present Duclaud— At P.U.S—about Steele and Coxe— Letters to J. J. Astor, to C. Hughes jr. and to Mrs Pinkney— Dined at P.U.S. Mexican Minister Zozaya— 40. Weekly Evening party— 150 persons— Johnson Hellen.

25. VI:30. Christmas day. Heard Little. Revelations 1.5. Visit to N. Edwards. Vance with him— Edwards’s politics— His Letter. The Land Office Appointments in Illinois— My Son Charles arrived— We had company to dine— Mr & Mrs Lloyd &c.

26. VII.R. M. Johnson and J. T. Johnson here for Seabury to be Marshal of Florida— C. Bulfinch—his Salary— Peyton great nephew to Mr Jefferson for a Clerkship and Mark Harris; with petition of pardon, for a Captain Edward Killeran— At the Office— Eustis—about Roberts— Views as to Nominations— Roberdeau. Letter from Genl. Swift— The Pendulum— Southard— Upon the Nominations to Office, in the Senate. A. Hamilton & Florida Charges. Evening at Menou’s Ball. Chess with Canning.

27. VII.S. Moore here—going to Augusta. Engaged in Manufactures, spoke of Ingham— The Election—Caucusing— Harmony &c— At the Office— M’Lean the Commr. with a Mr Long of Cincinnati— Farrelly, with Forward. Dr. Weightman, about judge Bethune’s Account. To be taken to P.U.S.Ellisen with a Letter from Baron de Tuyll— Liverpool 31. October— Expects to be detained there some weeks longer— Coll. Morrison from Kentucky—with Book from Humphreys— Elgar about Bulfinch’s Salary— List of Reductions— Contract. Began draft of Instructions for Mr. M’Rae— Letter from Alr. M’Rae— Diplomatic company to dine— Cards with Petry.

28. VII. Snowy Morning— At the Office— Senate’s Resolution about St. Domingo. Holmes— Took it to P.U.S— Letter from M’Rae—declines—despatches from R. Rush— Met Fuller at P.U.S. Answer to Gregg— Dined at Mrs Decatur’s. Canning— My Son John arrived— Bailey here this Eve.

29. VII:30—Fuller here— Morning absorbed— Call on Gaillard— At dinner— On Tod— Isaac Fisher an indifferent character— Knows nothing against his veracity— Tod said he had seen another Letter from him— He supposed on the same Subject—to M’Lane— Heard Little P.M. Hebrews 3.–4.5.6.— Evening idle at home. Publicola [symbols]. In Essex Register.

30. VII.Louis and Nicholas Williams here— Jonn. Jennings about the boy to be ransomed— At the Office. Alr. Scott from Pensacola— Sent my answer to Smyth, to Richmond Enquirer— Answer to Ruggles, Chairman of Come. of Claims Senate, on claim of Joseph Willcox— D. P. Cook and H. S. Edwards of Connt. spent the Evening here— Johnson Hellen off to Rockville.

31. VII.R. M. Johnson, for Chapman Coleman, to be Marshal of Kentucky. T. T. Tucker, with young Tucker— At the Office G. W. Erving— Letter from Isaac Winslow— Colonial Intercourse. B. Bassett recommendation of A. Hamilton. Printing of Territorial Laws Florida— House for judge Smith at St. Augustine— Weightman for judge Bethune’s Acct.— D. Trimble with judge Robins of Kentucky and Finley— Captn. Partridge— Canning— Ratification of Russian Convention received— Payment of Commrs— £1500 Commr. and £1000 Arbitrator— A Consul— The former Convention— Colonial Intercourse. Feeling— Weekly Evening party— About 110— Closing year—dancing. At P.U.S— Met Genl. Brown there.
The Lord gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son
1 [symbols] 15.4.
